content.rendered:
What is a Genetic Counselor?

Genetic Counselors are healthcare professionals who work with clients to educate them about the impact their own genetics have on daily life.

Where does a Genetic Counselor work?

  • Clinics
  • Private practices
  • Hospitals

How much does a Genetic Counselor make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for a Genetic Counselor is $66,000.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Genetic Counselors?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing this career path.

  • Biology majors
  • Chemistry majors
  • Anatomy majors
Search Genetic Counselors jobs on Handshake

Genetic Counselor skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Genetic Counselors succeed in their work:

  • Compassion and understanding
  • Attention to detail
  • Great listening and speaking skills

What are some common questions about Genetic Counselors?

Q: How long does it take to become a Genetic Counselor?

A: About 6 years of schooling.

excerpt.rendered: Learn about the average salary, relevant studies, related questions, and common path after college to becoming a Genetic Counselor.
